title: Zz'rot Portal - Is it viable? Come boogey with me in The Void.
body:
Hey :)

So I've been reading about the magical Zz'rot portal item and I was wanting your opinion on who you think it would be good to build on and when/how should it be used. Should a tanky top rush it and pressure their lane with the extra minion? Should a jungler buy it and use it to help out a lane instead of ganking? Should a support buy it?

Come boogey and brainstorm with me. I am confused about this item and that makes me sad.

Love,

~HitYouInTheFace

replies.body:
I don't know much about it. That said:

1) please dear god don't rush it. If you're putting an extra minion in the lane, you're giving your opponent more gold and xp, they're never going to gain a big enough advantage if you put it down early,  This sounds like a late game item! 

2) it's probably best used when you need a minion to tank a turret and lanes are pushed opposite you. This could work great on a split pusher with teleport, who can push an objective even without a pushed Lane. 

3) it might be a viable counter to super minions if the minion it spawns is stronger than normal minions.  At least to the point that a champion doesn't need to consistently babysit that Lane,  only needs to check in every few waves.
The minions providing gold is a bug on PBE. The minions won't provide gold. (The gate itself still does however)
Good! Do they/will they provide experience?  (I would hope not).
They won't. XP can be even more warping than gold; And worse! People won't generally realize it.
Do you have a champion/role you prefer to use this item on? Trying to see where it fits in the game or what creative uses you have for it.

Tanky bruisery people, Nasus and Irelia for instance. People who could potentially scrape through a fight late game.

It works best with wave clear to support it. For some tanky dudes (like Shen) it's not very effective unless you have at least a Sunfire to clear minions for it. That it attacks minions is more of a weakness than a strength.
Word of caution: Do NOT buy it against a Nasus. That's just asking to feed him free easy Q farm.

The usability range on it extends beyond that though. Internally, people have used it as a slow-to-activate blocking tool (think Trundle's pillar). I've also seen it used as a vision tool, since it provides a "line" of vision for 2.5 minutes. It can be way way stronger than a ward for vision, although also much much easier to find.

Also - can everyone on your team buy one and spam portals?? Or is there a limit to one per a certain area?

Edit: I love the idea of using it as a ward since it will give vision as they walk to lane :D How smart!

Your team can have multiple portals. You can't use multiple Zz'rot Portal actives yourself (they have a shared cooldown, like any other active item does), but there is no restriction currently for a team in that realm.

That said, placing a lot of portals in a concentrated area WILL guarantee you take whatever nearby structures REALLY quickly.
But you also just all committed a 2.5 minute cooldown to a single focus point. Which can be destroyed. And you all invested 2600 gold for that.
There's definite trade offs for gate spam and currently I'm okay with those trade offs. :)

A quick query if you're still here.

If I put a gate in the middle of the jungle, what will the minion do? Run to the nearest lane, attack the nearest monster, or have an existential crisis and die?

She* stated earlier that placing it in the jungler would have it walk to the nearest lane, thus giving you line of sight from where you placed it to the lane. It acts like a long, repeating ward that can be tracked down by enemies easily 

I hope this helped!

This is mostly correct.
It more tracks to the nearest lane, since it treats champions as "non threats". It will ignore them (but still get blocked by them) unless taunted.

There's also some logic about facing direction when  you cast it for a tie breaker when two lanes could be a potential target, but mostly that doesn't matter for the VAST majority of plays with it.
(Also, she*)
Oh, sorry! :D Thanks for letting me know. #Embarrassing
LoL... you sound like Heimerdinger should never play against Nasus...
Donger turrets > mini little minions that are easily killable and spam every 4 seconds.

Not sure if the "0 gold" is good or not.

If you are push under tower because of the matchmaking (lane bully), being force to kill something who doesn't give gold (because the voidling give minon kill gold to the one summoning them, like zyra plant) made you miss a lot more CS (and you can't easily kill a portal against a lane bully)

Give gold for one player but not for the other seems unfair (or the gold for the owner is a bug too?)

The voidspawn are relatively weak, especially since they self degrade after 4 seconds of being out (they deal 40% of their max HP to themselves each second after 4 seconds active).

The play of "dealing with an infinite number of minions" is not very fun in a PVP game, generally. Each of the iterations where the voidspawn were more of the focal point to defend from felt REALLY bad because of that.
The primary incentive as the defender against the Zz'rot Portal is to take out the void gate itself to stop the minions, not farm the minions.
That said, for the potential gold disparity point:
1. The Void Gate is worth gold and if the disparity is too much, we can increase the value of the gate itself.
2. The player buying and using Zz'rot Portal made an investment into the item, and gold gain from the item is not too different from the idea of gp10 items, Banner of Command, or even Sunfire Cape.

I'd also like to point out that as the person using Zz'rot Portal, it's more interesting for you when the main objective of it is the nonmoving, tanky point of conflict you created. You can do things like drop it into a bush and then gather your team there to create a gank bush with a free line of dangerous bait coming out. "Ooh, a piece of candy!" etc.

Didn't know they self destruct after 4sec.

But still, in case of an horrible matchup top lane (range vs melee), I didn't see how the losing side can destroy the gate if it's in the bush near the tower.
That means 37 minion more on your face that you must kill but give you nothing (more annoying mosquito than piece of candy)

I'm not against item with passiv gold farm like banner of command or sunfire cap, but the difference between them and the zz'rot portal is that, with them, the passive gold source come at your face and you can shutdown it (with the gate you need to bypass the frontline, hard if push under tower :s)

The item scales primarily off champion level and because of that it tends to be a very bad 1st item pick.

Also, the voidspawn degrades in such a way as so that you can't both protect it under a turret and take another turret with it. A couple of examples: (Click to see the album popup)
http://imgur.com/a/FisFx

In the top lane example, the voidspawn will BARELY reach the outer range of the opposing tower but it will die before the tower even gets a shot off.
In the middle lane example, the voidspawn will reach the range of the opposing tower with a fair bit of health, but it will die with a single tower shot.

The voidspawn also don't attack champions. They're not much of a mosquito to the champion itself.

It's especially bothering considering that his turrets have 24s cooldown and he doesn't get several turret stacks until he leveled his skill to 3. It basicllay means that your opponent will kill every turret of yours within less than a second 6 minutes of the game.

Please help our favorite crazy engineer :/

Hey, just out of curiosity, I am just trying to learn more here. 

So you have said: 

> The play of "dealing with an infinite number of minions" is not very fun in a PVP game, generally.

Can you please back your claim with some data? Where did you get this insight from?

Thanks!

Since we're talking about minion based items:
Would it be possible to slightly reduce the active cooldown on {{item:3060}} Banner of Command?
I don't really think it's justified that this item has as much cooldown as Zhona's. That's a whole different powerlevel which should be reflected in the cooldown of the active.

Edit: (Or maybe minion kills could reduce the cooldown?)

> Since we're talking about minion based items:
> Would it be possible to slightly reduce the active cooldown on {{item:3060}} Banner of Command?
> I don't really think it's justified that this item has as much cooldown as Zhona's. That's a whole different powerlevel which should be reflected in the cooldown of the active.

IIRC it's got a reduced CD on PBE right now. I think it was a 30 second reduction.

Your second choice makes it sound like it is going to be like Banner of Command {{item:3060}} which is pretty much an item no one buys (except on ARAM cuz trololol). I know that this one might be better because it spawns constantly, but still - most people prefer instant stats and HP vs something that will help a team over time. 

I hope they dont let the voidlings give gold... that would be annoying. I was thinking of rushing it as a tanky top laner, but that might not be in my best interest. :P

I doubt the minions will be stronger than normal minions, since it spawns one every 4 seconds.
The new banner of command it pretty awesome.

I see it simpley for those tanky split pusher. To give them a chance to actually keep up with the full damage split pushers. I don't really see it being used by many other champs with the stats it provides.

Riot said specifically that the voidspawn give 0 gold and 0 xp. The gate itself gives a *little* bit of gold, but that is it. I still would agree that it doesn't look like a good first item, maybe 3rd or 4th. The minions themselves don't actually tank turrets, they dive into it Kamikaze style and self destruct. they have low health (die in one tower shot) but are very low in the minion priority list for towers. The minions it makes are fragile, but deal a lot of damage and spawn frequently enough that they would probably freeze a lane with super minions in it. the minions only last for 7 seconds total (they go for 4 seconds, and then lose 40% of their hp per second after that, which is just under 3 seconds), so you wouldn't get any sort of sizable wave of them at any point.
this item is the answer to what you buy when your GA is on cd
Please explain your reasoning. :D

GA provides a healthy chunk of armor and mr, but you buy it for the rez passive. thus when GA is on cd, it feels like yer wasting a slot on the item, but at the same time, you don't want to give up the defense stats.

now, you can sell GA and buy this item and have a new active to play with while you wait on the cd to time out on GA.

Hm, I like that idea, but I also think {{item:3102}}  is a great replacement since it offers defense and the negating of one spell. BUT I definitely like the idea. I have to see how effective the passive is to consider using it as a swap out for on CD GA.

I would say that it doesn't seem like a good buy for a junglier or support before late game, because the void minions would steal all the laners/ADCs minions. after mid game is over, I would say those two should certainly get it since it basically is free pressure on one lane (It looks like you could even stall a lane with super minions in it, which could relieve a TON of pressure in a turtling situation). I would say any solo lane looking for a defensive item could take full advantage of it, it gives a nice handful of stats, and some tower pushing power. If I were a tanky top, I would buy this later on after a couple large health items, If I were a damage focus tp laner, I would buy this shortly before the first tower falls and then use it to fast push for the second. I see it as being a good defensive item for a mage as well (If they plan on buying a defensive item that is, mostly I just build a ton of AP and go relatively glass cannon), since it would help them push towers faster. I would probably use this item on champs that don't want to roam too much, since then they leave their portal undefended, and not being a roaming type means you can push your lane especially hard when you roaming opponent leaves lane.

I predict that this will actually put a lot of pressure on roam focussed champs, and may put less mobile champs in a position of dominance. I can also see this as a game winning type of item, you got one inhib, you have super minions, then you also have you voidspawn. Together, that could put so much pressure on a single lane that the opposing team would barely be able to contest Baron, Dragon, or another tower (unless of course they all buy a Zz'rot's Portal themselves to counter it).
A lot of your points are kind of where I am leaning. Cannot wait to test it out! :) Late game support with that extra bit of push!
There is no reason to buy when pushing in super easy right now, towers melt too fast.
i'm interested in seeing how the item works with {{champion:90}} . i don't think he benefits the most from the stats, but it might put his pushing over the top (especially AD malzahar)
when malz uses the item it should spawn one of malz's passive voidlings every 4 seconds instead of those week things >:D
except their AI is better at taking towers than Malz's voidlings.
All of the three seem viable.  Though I suspect you'll not want to rush this first as it seems better as a second or third item.

I think the importance of this item isn't just coming from the mechanic of it, but the fact that this sort of mechanic is even being brought in. It's a great step away from direct player-on-player focused attacks, and more into strategic placement and indirect conflict options that I love to have available.

I think I might try it on some junglers as their Armor/MR item (3rd item) to help lanes push while ganking. No longer will I have to be present to tax a lane when I have voidlings to do my bidding.

As for heimerdinger... I think it will be a blast to get as an item.
